methods.name: <init>

methods.javadoc:
Invoke the dialog.
@return the exit condition of the dialog.  The return value can be one of:
 CANCELED - the user canceled the action.
 OK - the user pressed the "Ok" button or pressed the return key in the textfield.
methods.name: showSetDialog

return.comment:
the exit condition of the dialog.  The return value can be one of:
 CANCELED - the user canceled the action.
 OK - the user pressed the "Ok" button or pressed the return key in the textfield.

methods.javadoc:
Invoke the dialog.
@return the exit condition of the dialog.  The return value can be one of:
 CANCELED - the user canceled the action.
 OK - the user pressed the "Ok" button or pressed the return key in the textfield.
methods.name: showRenameDialog

return.comment:
the exit condition of the dialog.  The return value can be one of:
 CANCELED - the user canceled the action.
 OK - the user pressed the "Ok" button or pressed the return key in the textfield.

methods.javadoc: Get the Equate Name entered or chosen by the user.
methods.name: getEquateName
methods.comment: Get the Equate Name entered or chosen by the user.

methods.javadoc:
Get's the user selected entry in the dialog and returns the enum data type for that entry
@return the enum data type for the selected entry, or null if there is no enum.
methods.name: getEnumDataType
methods.comment: Get's the user selected entry in the dialog and returns the enum data type for that entry

return.comment: the enum data type for the selected entry, or null if there is no enum.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the type of selection the user has chosen.
@return
methods.name: getSelectionType
methods.comment: Returns the type of selection the user has chosen.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if the user has chosen to overwrite any existing equate rules.
@return
methods.name: getOverwriteExisting
methods.comment: Returns true if the user has chosen to overwrite any existing equate rules.

methods.javadoc:
Set the state of the some buttons on the dialog.  ie: if the user has selected
 a range of addresses we should automatically set the "selection" radio button
 to the selected state.
@param context The current context.
methods.name: setHasSelection
methods.comment:
Set the state of the some buttons on the dialog.  ie: if the user has selected
 a range of addresses we should automatically set the "selection" radio button
 to the selected state.
